person.note: Xia(2) Song [703] Partisan of Yang(2) Huangtaihou, regent during Zhao(1) Renzong's [9004] (qv.) minority. Song was Anqi's [698] father, Boqing's [7237] grandfather, Gong's [701] direct ancestor, and Jia(3) Shouna's [7191] and father-in-law. Yi [700] has the same generational name as his grandsons. He was buried in Xuzhou, Yangdi (a burial place for many Kaifeng residents) and died in his home in Kaifeng. His grandaughter was listed as a Kaifeng resident in Fan Zuyu, WJ, 52.1a. Ni [13071], listed in CBD as a grandson, was a Qi(a), Qichun resident where he probably moved from Kaifeng at begining of Southern Song. Ni cannot be a grandson since Song's only son, Anqi, had only two sons, Bosun [18438] and Boqing. Since Anqi's grandsons all use radical 61 as a generational indicator (at least those alive in 1091!), I am assuming that Ni was a grandnephew as was Yi [700] and am leaving descendant Gong [701] and probable grandnephew Yi in Jiangzhou for the time being. Song's reputed Latter Han ancestor, Qin [13072], was also a Jiujiang resident and although not contained in the NanBei and Tang lists of choronyms, or in Johnson's list, I am designating this Xia lineage as a Jiujiang jun (a Qin commandery) Xia. XCB, 121.15a, 122.15a; SS, 283.13b; Wang Gui, WJ, 47.6a-13a. CBD, 3, 1807-8.
